result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Ronald R Juday

records.addlTxt:
22CF70 & 22CF71 Cases called @ 2:55 PM Defendant Ronald R Juday in court.  Attorney Benjamin T Van Severen in court for Ronald R Juday.  Attorney Matthew R. Leusink in court for State of Wisconsin. 
The Court addresses the motion for joinder filed by DA Leusink. No objection by Atty Van Severen. The Court does enter an order joining 22CF70 & 22CF71. DA Leusink to file an Amended Information.  Court addresses defense and State's motion in limine and grants the same. The Court enters a sequestration order. Ludwig colloquy addressed on the record. Court addresses trial logistics with counsel. 24 in box, 5 strikes.
